data.text: @FructoseNo Is Pamela Stephenson on Twitter?   Have they seen this ?

@FructoseNo It's irresponsible to offer unsolicited advice on Billy's PD & alleged (disputed) dementia. Nutritional ketosis may have a role in the management of many conditions, but to suggest he has missed out on significant benefit based on 1 tiny (5 people) uncontrolled study is snake oil
@FructoseNo Saw this late; thank you very much for sharing.
@FructoseNo Only Parkinson says that he has dementia. He and Pamela are denying it.

@FructoseNo Thanks Gary. Why the hell isn’t a ketogenic diet utilized more often. Even if the benefits are slightly questionable any benefits would be better than a death by sugar/carbs. Pardon that blatant dig. The benefits in this doc are clear however.
@FructoseNo @BelindaFettke My aunt was diagnosed a yr ago, symptoms evident to everyone now. Not one family member listens about diet, docs tell them it's genetics and/or age. Sad.
@FructoseNo Where’s the science that says keto duets worj for early PD?

@FructoseNo Hang about. All of these reports about him having dementia are in the Aus press. He and his family released a statement yesterday saying that Michael Parkinson’s claims were rubbish, that he has no probs recognising people & was filming over summer. False news?
@mickyc11 @FructoseNo @TuitNutrition has written a great book about using LCHF to prevent and potentially treat AD
@FructoseNo We tried it with my mum who has Alzheimer's. Unfortunately it proved to difficult to get her to stick to it and to get the carers who worked with her to support it.

@FructoseNo Such a sad story for #BillyConnelly. A great man who has brightened my life. I am a mad keto supporter and hopefully keto helps many people avoid this fate. How much evidence is there that it can help or prevent?
